isis.stitle: DCM AND DDM DRUM TYPE PARKING BRAKE - ADJUSTMENT - BENDIX DDM AIR OR HYDRAULIC ACTUATED

svcproc.title: BENDIX DDM AIR OR HYDRAULIC ACTUATED

figure.caption: Figure 21. Bendix DDM Air or Hydraulic Actuated

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 5-1/2 INCHES, WITH AIR OR HYDRAULIC PRESSURE RELEASED, ROD EXTENDED

step1.para: Pull out on the parking brake control knob to apply the parking brake.
To adjust rod length, loosen the large jam nut (Item 1).
Remove the cotter and clevis pins (Item 3). Remove the clevis from the cam and lever assembly (Item 4).
Lengthen or shorten dimension (Item A) by turning the clevis.

note.para: Be sure the brake chamber rod is fully extended while measuring its length (Item A).

step1.para: When the 5-1/2 inch dimension is achieved, re-install the clevis (Item 2) on the cam and lever assembly (Item 4) and secure with the clevis and cotter pins (Item 3).
Tighten the jam nut (Item 1) against the clevis (Item 2).
Re-check dimension (Item A) and re-adjust if necessary.
